title._content: Characteristic ruin, of the Pueblo San Juan, New Mexico, on the north bank of the San Juan River, about 15 miles west of the mouth of Cañon Largo. (LOC)

description._content: O'Sullivan, Timothy H., 1840-1882, photographer. Characteristic ruin, of the Pueblo San Juan, New Mexico, on the north bank of the San Juan River, about 15 miles west of the mouth of Cañon Largo. [United States], 1874. 1 photographic print on stereo card : albumen. Notes: Photo shows the photographer Timothy O'Sullivan, seated on right, next to his 10x12-inch large-plate camera. Original negative number: 52. Caption number on back of stereo: No. 43. Title from item. Part of series: U.S. War Dept., Corps of Engineers; Geographical Explorations and Surveys West of 100th Meridian, Expedition of 1874; Lieut. Geo. M. Wheeler, commanding. Part of: Indian Pueblo Ruins, San Juan, N.M. Series. Published in: Framing the West: The Survey Photographs of Timothy H. O'Sullivan / Toby Jurovics, Carol M. Johnson, Glenn Willumson, and William F. Stapp. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2010, p. 37. Format: Expedition photographs--1870-1880. Stereographs--1870-1880. Albumen prints--1870-1880. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/stereo.1s00391 Call Number: LOT 3427-4, no. 21 [item]
